title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting downWindows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: When a user shuts down Windows while a WSWB session is open with an unsaved .txt file, the changes made to the file are lost without any warning or opportunity to save.
SR:
1. Open WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as dirty.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the “Shut Down…” command to shutdown or reboot the computer.
5. Result: There is no warning or question message box, and the computer is shut down or rebooted immediately, causing the loss of unsaved files.
